segment.source: Enable Legacy Applications and Accelerate Upgrades to New Operating Systems
segment.target: Enable Legacy Applications and Accelerate Upgrades to New Operating Systems

segment.source: Incompatibility of legacy applications with new versions of Windows can often delay enterprise upgrades to the latest version of Windows.
segment.target: Incompatibility of legacy applications with new versions of Windows can often delay enterprise upgrades to the latest version of Windows.

segment.source: Testing and migrating applications takes time, and users are unable to take advantage of the new capabilities and enhancements offered by the newest operating system.
segment.target: Testing and migrating applications takes time, and users are unable to take advantage of the new capabilities and enhancements offered by the newest operating system.

segment.source: By delivering applications in a Virtual PC that runs a previous version of the operating system (for example, Windows XP or Windows 2000), MED-V removes the barriers to operating system upgrades and allows administrators to complete testing and address incompatible applications after the upgrade.
segment.target: By delivering applications in a Virtual PC that runs a previous version of the operating system (for example, Windows XP or Windows 2000), MED-V removes the barriers to operating system upgrades and allows administrators to complete testing and address incompatible applications after the upgrade.

segment.source: From the user's perspective, these applications are accessible from the standard desktop Start menu and appear side-by-side with native applications—so there is minimal change to the user experience.
segment.target: From the user's perspective, these applications are accessible from the standard desktop Start menu and appear side-by-side with native applications—so there is minimal change to the user experience.
